pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:0.5_0: The training rule on spatching his head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.11_0: if he makes a blanket in a lump;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.15_0: The first rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were laughing loudly while walking in inhabited areas. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not laugh loudly while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.4_0: One should not laugh loudly while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk11:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, laughs loudly while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
